src.utils

Utility functions. These functions are used in mutliple places throughout the source code and cannot be coupled to any particular module.

src.utils.fix_game_times(games)[source]

Cleans the gametime column.

Impute missing game times based on weekday column. Games on Sunday are imputed to start at 13:00. Games on Monday are imputed to start at 20:15.

Replace 9:00 with 21:00.

Parameters:

games (pd.DataFrame) – Raw games dataframe.

Returns:

Cleaned game times.

Return type:

pd.Series

src.utils.get_date_n_days_out(n)[source]

Get the date n days from today.

Parameters:

n (int) – number of days from today

Returns:

date n days from today in YYYY-MM-DD format

Return type:

str

src.utils.get_kickoff_hours(gametimes)[source]

Extract the hour when kickoff takes place.

Parameters:

gametimes (pd.Series) – a column of game times

Returns:

kickoff hours

Return type:

pd.Series

src.utils.map_team_data_to_games(games, stats, feature_name)[source]

Map a pandas series of team stats with a season/week/team multiindex to game_ids in the games data.

Parameters:

  • games (pd.DataFrame) – raw games dataframe

  • stats (pd.Series) – series of team stats with season/week/team index

Returns:

dataframe with game_id, away_team_stat, home_team_stat

Return type:

pd.DataFrame

src.utils.refresh_raw_data(url, save_path)[source]

Fetches data from a URL and saves to disk.

Parameters:

  • url (str) – URL to fetch data from

  • path (str) – Path to save data to

Returns:

None

Return type:

None

src.utils.shift_week_number(df, n, dropna=True)[source]

Shifts the week index of a season/team/week multiindex.

Aggregations are nearly always calculated up to the end of a week. Shifting is useful when you want your stats to align with the week before or the week after (consistent with the bye weeks).

Parameters:

  • df (pd.DataFrame) – dataframe with season/team/week multiindex

  • n (int) – number of rows to shift

  • dropna (bool) – whether to drop rows with missing values

Returns:

dataframe with shifted season/team index

Return type:

pd.DataFrame

src.utils.walk_features_dir(features_path)[source]

Yield every py file path in the features dir.

Parameters:

features_path (str) – path to features directory

Returns:

feature file path

Return type:

str
